alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 18 at 7:48PM EST until January 19 at 10:27AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Tar River At Tarboro affecting Edgecombe County. Lower Roanoke River At Roanoke Rapids affecting Halifax and Northampton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Tar River at Tarboro. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, The river is at bankfull. At 19.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. The Riverside Park and River Road at the US64 bridge flood. At 20.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins south of Daniel Street in east Tarboro. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EST Thursday the stage was 19.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - The river crested at 21.9 feet Wednesday afternoon. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 6.6 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tar River Tarboro 19.0 19.5 Thu 7 pm EST 13.5 10.2 8.3 7.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued by Friday morning at 800 AM EST.
